roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses

Class Battery

  • java.lang.Object
    • roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
        • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Item
          • roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Battery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEnergyHolder

    public class Battery
extends Item
implements IEnergyHolder
    A class of batteries. Extends Item and implements IEnergyHolder.
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Battery()
      Initialize this new battery without a position or a board and with an energy level of 0 Ws and a weight of 0 g.
      Battery(double energyAmount, int weight)
      Initialize this new battery with given the given amount of energy and weight.
      Battery(Position position, Board board, double energyAmount, int weight)
      Initialize this new battery with given the given board, position, amount of energy [Ws] and weight [g].

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this battery.
      boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
      Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this battery.

      Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this battery.

      Returns the variable representing the current amount if energy of this battery in the given energy unit.
      double getEnergyFraction()
      Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this battery can have.
      double getMaxEnergy()
      Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this battery can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      void recharge(double amount)
      Recharges this battery with the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
      void setEnergy(double energyAmount)
      Sets the amount of energy of this battery to the given amount of energy in Watt-second [Ws].
      void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
      Sets the maximum energy level of this battery to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
      void takeHit()
      When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered.

      Returns a string representation of this battery.

      Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this battery to another IEnergyHolder.

      • Battery

        public Battery(Position position,
       Board board,
       double energyAmount,
       int weight)
        Initialize this new battery with given the given board, position, amount of energy [Ws] and weight [g].
        Parameters:
        position - The position for this new item.
        board - The board on which this new item will be placed.
        energyAmount - The amount of energy for this new battery in watt-seconds [Ws].
        weight - The weight for this new battery, expressed in grams [g].

        weight - The weight for this new battery in grams [g].

        Initialize this new battery without a position or a board and with an energy level of 0 Ws and a weight of 0 g.

      • canHaveAsEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsEnergy(double energy)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid amount of energy for this battery.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        energy - The amount of energy to be checked, expressed in Watt-second.
        Returns:
        False if the given energy is greater than or equal to the maximal amount of energy an IEnergyHolder can have. | result != (energy > this.getMaxEnergy())

      • getMaxEnergy

        public double getMaxEnergy()
        Returns the variable representing the maximum amount of energy this battery can have, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Specified by:
        getMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder

      • setMaxEnergy

        public void setMaxEnergy(double maxEnergyAmount)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the maximum energy level of this battery to the given maximum energy level, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Specified by:
        setMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        maxEnergyAmount - The new maximum energy level for this IEnergyHolder in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder is terminated. | this.isTerminated()
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - When the maximum energy level of this IEnergeHolder cannot be altered. | ! (this instance of Robot)

      • canHaveAsMaxEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsMaxEnergy(double maxEnergy)
        Check whether the given maximum energy, expressed in Watt-second [Ws], is a valid maximum energy for this battery.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsMaxEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        maxEnergy - The maximum energy level to be checked, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if the given energy is greater 5000 Ws. | result != (energy > 5000)

      • getEnergyFraction

        public double getEnergyFraction()
        Returns a percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this battery can have.
        Specified by:
        getEnergyFraction in interface IEnergyHolder
        Returns:
        A percentage of the current energy level relative to the maximum amount of energy this IEnergyHolder can have. | result == (this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)) / this.getMaxEnergy()) * 100

      • recharge

        public void recharge(double amount)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Recharges this battery with the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Specified by:
        recharge in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of energy to be added to this IEnergyHolder, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • canAcceptForRecharge

        public boolean canAcceptForRecharge(double amount)
        Checks whether the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], can be added to the current energy level of this battery.
        Specified by:
        canAcceptForRecharge in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to be checked, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws].
        Returns:
        False if this IEnergyHolder cannot have a total energy level equal to the given amount of energy added to its current energy level. | result == (this.canHaveAsEnergy(this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + amount))

      • transferEnergy

        public void transferEnergy(IEnergyHolder other,
                  double amount)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Transfers the given amount of energy, expressed in watt-seconds [Ws], from this battery to another IEnergyHolder.
        Specified by:
        transferEnergy in interface IEnergyHolder
        Parameters:
        other - The IEnergyHolder to be given energy.
        amount - The amount of energy to be transferred, expressed in watt-second [Ws].
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this IEnergyHolder or the other IEnergyHolder is terminated | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()

      • use

        public void use(Robot robot)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        The given robot uses this battery. As much energy as possible is transferred from this battery to the robot.
        Specified by:
        use in class Item
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that uses this item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | this.isTerminated() || robot.isTerminates()

      • takeHit

        public void takeHit()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. A battery increases its energy with 500 Ws when hit if possible. Otherwise its energy is set to the maximum energy level.
        Specified by:
        takeHit in class Item
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When this battery is terminated. | this.isTerminated()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this battery.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Item
        Returns:
        ... | result == "Battery with:" + "\n" | + super.toString() + "\n" | + " Energy level [Ws]: " + this.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND) + "(" + getEnergyFraction() + "%)"
